decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, aiming to control the board and maintain a strong presence. Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd as the commander adds additional power and utility to the deck, providing a versatile strategy. The deck includes a mix of creatures with strong abilities and protection spells like Mother of Runes and Giver of Runes to keep key creatures on the field. Additionally, there are cards like Palace Jailer and Skyclave Apparition for removal, as well as cards like Swords to Plowshares for additional control. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of spells and creatures to disrupt your opponent's strategy while building up your own board presence. Glarb, Calamity's Augur serves as the commander, providing access to powerful control elements. The deck includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push, counterspells such as Force of Will and Mana Leak, and disruptive creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Rune-Scarred Demon. The deck also features graveyard recursion with cards like Animate Dead and Necromancy, allowing you to reuse powerful creatures. By controlling the game and disrupting your opponent's plans, you can secure victory through strategic gameplay and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast and efficient creatures along with burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Ghyrson Starn, Kelermorph serves as the commander, providing a strong aggro strategy with cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Chain Lightning, and Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and True-Name Nemesis help to control the battlefield and pressure the opponent. The mana base is well-balanced with various lands to support the aggressive game plan, allowing the deck to consistently apply pressure and close out games swiftly.
